data.title: I'm a snob of crepes and drive to Bentonville all the time for them
data.text: And I'm going to have to continue to do that.  I think the biggest issue I have with this is that the crepes are premade, and because of that they aren't fresh or as thin as they should be.  Also the ham in a ham and cheese crepe shouldn;t be so salty you need water. Should be thinly sliced and done right

data.title: Tasty and Fresh
data.text: Small size but big taste!  Fresh ingredients mark the crepes here.  You may end up making new friends since there are only a few tables but it is worth the excellence that goes into the savory and sweet goodness.  A little something for whatever mood you're in and most of not all of the ingredients locally sourced, what's not to love!  Try it, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Tasty crepes made to order with fresh ingredients
data.text: We visited this new, small (only 4-5 tables) restaurant for brunch.  We drove about 30 miles to check it out and it was well worth the drive.  We were there about 9:30 on a weekday and there was plenty of street parking (no charge for 2 hours) around the corner.   All of their crepes are made to order while you wait.  The crepes are divided into sweet or savory, and all of the ingredients are very flavorful and obtained locally, if possible.  I had the B.L.T. Crepe with greens, bacon, tomatoes and mayonnaise.  It was delicious.  Two of our party had the Morning Glory Crepe with egg, bacon, choice of cheese & choice of hot sauce.  My husband really liked the Louisiana hot sauce.  The House Crepe (one of the sweet crepes), selected by one of our dining companions, had bananas, strawberries, honey & Greek yogurt.  While each crepe was fixed and served separately, they were wrapped in foil when we received them so that they all remained hot so we could enjoy them together.  Beverages included a variety of coffees, teas and Italian sodas.

data.title: Tasty crepes made to order with fresh ingredients
data.text: We learned about this new restaurant and drove 30 miles to check it out.  We were not disappointed.  This new creperie is in a small space on the main street in downtown Conway, with ample complimentary 2-hour parking in front and right around the corner.  The menu includes sweet crepes and savory crepes, made in front of you while you wait with fresh, local ingredients.  The House Crepe included a choice of two fruits (blueberries, strawberries or bananas), a "drizzle" of your choice of Nutella, peanut butter or local honey) and Greek yogurt.  One of our group had the House Crepe with strawberries, bananas, honey and Greek yogurt, and she loved it!  There were several other choices for sweet crepes.  On the savory side, I had the BLT Crepe with bacon, fresh greens, tomatoes and mayonnaise.  The ingredients were so fresh and it was delicious!  Two of our party had the Morning Lover Crepe with egg, choice of cheese, spinach, bacon (optional) and a choice of hot sauce.  My husband enjoyed the Louisiana hot sauce on his crepe.  The crepes came out in the order that they were requested, but they were wrapped in foil and plenty hot so we were able to wait until all four of us got our orders before we started eating, and no one's food got cold.  The restaurant offered a nice selection of coffees, tea and Italian sodas.  Hopefully, once the owners get established, they'll open a restaurant in Little Rock so we won't have to drive so far for a delicious, fresh meal.
